tweet: The humanitarian crisis at our southern border needs more than just additional resources—it needs ACCOUNTABILITY to address the abuse and negligence of the federal government against migrants, especially children. That's why I *opposed* the Senate border supplemental bill.
I'm deeply disappointed in today's #SCOTUS decision on gerrymandering. The people should choose their elected officials, not the other way around. This is a blow to representational democracy.

The conditions in the detention centers at our border are inhumane and kids are suffering. I joined a majority in the House yesterday in voting to provide humanitarian relief to those detained, but we must also ensure proper oversight and accountability measures are put in place.

Four years ago, SCOTUS made history by ruling same-sex couples have a constitutional right to marry. We've come a long way in the fight for LGBTQ equality, but still have much to do. I'm proud to support legislation that supports & protects our LGBTQ community. #LBGTQEqualityDay

President Trump is wrong. The Constitution states the President needs congressional approval before attacking any country. My War Powers bill would strengthen Congress’s war powers authority & require an exit strategy for any US military action: https://bit.ly/2X62WBs
I had a productive meeting with the President of ⁦@MADDOnline⁩ today learning about new technologies that can detect and deter the preventable crime of drunk driving: pic.twitter.com/l8ND87yvx5

In 2017 @OregonState Prof Dr. William Ripple published a scientific warning to humanity: take action on climate change NOW, or face dire consequences. I've entered his warning into the Congressional Record as a message to my colleagues: This is an existential threat to us all. pic.twitter.com/nEOJSxnxCF

NSA Bolton is chomping at the bit to attack Iran, and he’s moving the President towards that decision. However, only Congress—not President Trump—has the power to declare war. I’ve reintroduced my bill to strengthen Congress’s Constitutionally-granted war powers authority.

The Trump Administration has come to its senses and has REVERSED the decision to close the Job Corps CCC programs—highly successful programs that train low-income youth to become first responders for natural disasters. This is a huge win for SW Oregon! https://www.politico.com/story/2019/06/19/perdue-reverses-jobs-corps-closures-congress-backlash-3458109 …

This would be an outrageous violation of our Constitution. I will be re-introducing legislation to re-assert Congress's constitutional authority to declare war and act as a check on the Trump administration: https://www.politico.com/story/2019/06/18/trump-congress-iran-1366756 …

Here's news that will surprise absolutely nobody—Big businesses are paying fewer taxes than ever before under the GOP's new tax plan, while working families aren't seeing benefits: https://www.politico.com/story/2019/06/13/big-businesses-pay-less-tax-law-1364591 …

The U.S. spends more on prescription drugs than anywhere else in the world—more than $1000 per capita. I'm pushing my colleagues in Congress to pass legislation to require the federal government to negotiate lower drug prices for all Americans. #ProtectOurCare pic.twitter.com/FJAhCthcd9

Proud my amendment to protect Job Corps CCC programs from effectively being shut down just passed the House w/bipartisan support. These programs give young people from low-income backgrounds cutting-edge vocational training & a pathway out of poverty. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nQqQsdGLyZg&feature=youtu.be …

Yesterday, ODFW approved a plan to allow untrained hunters to assist in predator control measures, giving Wildlife Services even more unchecked authority than they already have. This plan puts both animals and humans at risk and I stand firmly in opposition to it.

Higher education ought to provide opportunities, not financial burdens. My legislation, the HIGHER ED and AID Acts, will increase college access and relieve student loan debt so that all students can focus on their futures: https://defazio.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-peter-defazio-introduces-higher-ed-aid-acts-to-improve-student-loan …

Got behind the wheel—and behind the handlebars—of both the driving simulator and bike simulator at @OregonState, where OSU and @uoregon researchers are designing safer roads for bikes and cars and developing connected transportation systems. pic.twitter.com/43BZ05dBPd

Visiting the @OregonState Kiewit Materials Performance Lab where researchers collaborating with industry are finding ways to both reduce carbon and extend the life of concrete—and even pioneering an experimental super-low CO2 concrete! pic.twitter.com/RoP2mt3zkU

I have fought long and hard to ensure that our skies are safe – for the traveling public and for pilots and flight crews.  I was honored to receive @WeAreALPA’s Pilot Partisan of the Year award and remain committed to advocating on behalf of aviation workers. pic.twitter.com/EcY1HLhFmg

Huge news: 90,000 'blue water' vets who were exposed to cancer-causing chemicals while serving in the seas off Vietnam will FINALLY be eligible for disability benefits. Massive step forward, but Congress must pass a bill to permanently right this wrong. https://www.militarytimes.com/news/pentagon-congress/2019/06/05/90000-blue-water-vietnam-veterans-in-line-for-disability-benefits-after-justice-officials-drop-appeal/ …

Last week, I had the honor of speaking at the American cemetery in Normandy to commemorate #DDay75thAnniversary. While we can never repay the enormous debt owed to those who fought and died on D-Day, we must always remember their courage and their sacrifice. pic.twitter.com/rPXtcilBhm

Today, the House passed H.R. 6, giving #Dreamers a pathway to citizenship. We must do more, though. Congress needs to keep working together to towards bipartisan, comprehensive immigration reform as well as robust investments in our border security—both land and maritime.

Trump is rolling back vital protections that protect our environment and curb greenhouse gases. While he's doing the bidding of the fossil fuel industry, his actions could lead to thousands of deaths and massive increases in greenhouse gases. https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2019/climate/trump-environment-rollbacks.html …

Today it was #AllEyesOnJuliana as oral arguments started in Our Children's Trust's case vs the US govt for their inaction on climate change. I'm proud of the 21 young plaintiffs and the work they're doing to require the federal government to act on our climate crisis.

While traveling in Germany last week I ran into Jonathan Dahl, a constituent from Roseburg and a Security Forces Member with the 86th Security Forces Squadron, at Ramstein Airbase. Jonathan, thanks for your service -- hope to see you at home in Roseburg soon! pic.twitter.com/v845GpGaO3
